descriptions.description: GConf is a system for storing application preferences. It is intended for user preferences; not configuration of something like Apache, or arbitrary data storage.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=gconf PACKAGE_VERSION=3.2.6
oegimport glib # required oegimport libiconv oegimport zlib oegimport libffi oegimport gettext oegimport pcre oegimport libxml2 # compile-time only? oegimport libxslt # compile-time only? oegimport dbus # required oegimport dbus-glib # required: dbus-1 >= 1.0.0 dbus-glib-1 >= 0.74 oegimport expat
oegextract GConf-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.xz
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" #cp AUTHORS COPYING README THANKS "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} --disable-gtk --disable-documentation --disable-gtk-doc --disable-gtk-doc-html make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
